meanings.definition: The quality or state of lacking grace or elegance.
meanings.sent1: Her gracelessnesses in movement made her stand out in the ballet class.
meanings.sent2: The room was filled with gracelessnesses as the children tried to dance elegantly.
meanings.sent3: Despite her gracelessnesses, she always managed to make everyone laugh during dance practice.
meanings.sent4: The gracelessnesses of his speech were like a stumbling block in the flow of the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The gracelessnesses of the painting were evident in every brushstroke.

meanings.definition: The act or instance of being awkward or clumsy.
meanings.sent1: His gracelessnesses on the dance floor were quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent2: The gracelessnesses of the new waiter were evident as he spilled drinks everywhere.
meanings.sent3: Despite his gracelessnesses, he managed to finish the race in record time.
meanings.sent4: Her gracelessnesses in social situations were like a comedy show for her friends.
meanings.sent5: The gracelessnesses of his movements were a stark contrast to the graceful swan nearby.

meanings.definition: The absence of charm or poise.
meanings.sent1: The party was filled with gracelessnesses, making it a rather dull affair.
meanings.sent2: Her gracelessnesses in conversation often led to awkward silences.
meanings.sent3: Despite the gracelessnesses of the situation, they managed to have a good time.
meanings.sent4: The gracelessnesses of his manners were like a dark cloud over the dinner table.
meanings.sent5: The room exuded gracelessnesses, making everyone feel uncomfortable.
